articles.title: 7 Nasdaq Stocks to Sell in March Before They Crash & Burn
summarizedBulletPoints: - **Riot Platforms (RIOT)**: Despite Bitcoin's boom since the year's start, Riot Platforms, a Bitcoin mining company's stock, has not surged in price due to the upcoming Bitcoin halving event which will reduce mining rewards by 50%. This presents a major challenge for crypto mining companies. While Riot has ambitious expansion plans that may offset the impact of the halving, there is significant uncertainty regarding future results, leading to wide-ranging forecasts for 2025 earnings. Given these factors, RIOT stock is considered one of the Nasdaq stocks to sell.
articles.desc: Out of over 4000 stocks listed on the world's second largest stock exchange, these are the top seven Nasdaq stocks to sell.

Before They Crash & Burn",    "datePublished": "2024-03-14T06:45:00-04:00",    "dateModified": "2024-03-14T06:45:00-04:00",    "image": {        "@type": "ImageObject",        "url": "https:\/\/investorplace.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/07\/sell-thumbs-down-four.jpg",        "height": 900,        "width": 1600    },    "articleBody": "eXp World Holdings (EXPI): EXPI stock is expensive because of uncertain interest rate changes. Robinhood Markets (HOOD): The HOOD stock rebound, driven largely by the end of 'crypto winter,' may prove fleeting. Lucid Group (LCID): LCID stock is in a dilution spiral, relying on cash infusions from majority shareholder. Keep reading for more Nasdaq stocks to sell in March!\u00a0 With Nasdaq stocks to sell, speculative stocks in fast-growing industries like artificial intelligence, crypto mining, and electric vehicles may be what first comes to mind. However, while there are stocks in these industries well worth pressing the \"sell\" button on, it’s important to note the Nasdaq Exchange, while associated strongly with growth stocks and tech stocks, has listings for a wide variety of stocks. According to Finviz, over 4000 stocks are Nasdaq-listed. The Nasdaq is also the world’s second-largest stock exchange by market cap, second only to the New York Stock Exchange. As such, the list of Nasdaq stocks runs the gamut, from mega-cap to micro-cap, from new school to old school, and from speculative growth to deep value. As we’ll see below, alongside some questionable AI, crypto, and electric vehicle plays trading on the Nasdaq exchange, there are quite a few Nasdaq stocks to sell that fit into this other, wider category. eXp World Holdings (EXPI) Source: rafapress \/ Shutterstock.comeXp World Holdings (NASDAQ:EXPI) is a real estate services company. The company is both a real estate brokerage firm and a provider of technology\/lead generation services to real estate agents. EXPI stock took a dive when the pandemic-era housing boom cooled down in 2022, but shares have held up reasonably well in the past year. Expectations run high that lower interest rates will spur a housing market comeback, either this year or next year. Earnings forecasts for eXp World Holdings call for earnings to soar from 24 to 44 cents per share between 2024 and 2025, presumably because of a rate-cut rebound. However, with the Federal Reserve still \"monitoring the situation\" with interest rates, you may not want to wager that this earnings recovery for EXPI will take shape so quickly, especially as shares trade at a pricey 30.6 times this 2025 forecast. Robinhood Markets (HOOD) Source: mundissima \/ Shutterstock.comSome of the Nasdaq stocks to sell are stocks favorited by retail traders using platforms like Robinhood Markets’ (NASDAQ:HOOD) brokerage firm, but HOOD itself is also on this list. Since late November, shares in the company have more than doubled in price. This rebound in retail market speculation, especially in areas like crypto, can be attributed to the increase in demand boosting Robinhood’s fiscal results. For instance, for Q4 2023, the company positively surprised investors, by reporting positive earnings for the period. Yet while an end to \"crypto winter\" (ironically, taking shape near the start of astronomical winter in the northern hemisphere) has been a boon for Robinhood and for HOOD stock, this may prove fleeting. Shares now trade at a rich 77.7 times forward earnings. Any sort of slowdown in crypto\/stock trading activity could spark big disappointment, and a big reversal for this stock. Lucid Group (LCID) Source: Around the World Photos \/ Shutterstock.comShares in many electric vehicle manufacturers trade on the Nasdaq, but among the larger Nasdaq electric vehicle stocks, Lucid Group (NASDAQ:LCID) is the one most deserving of a sell rating. Although I’m bearish on Rivian Automotive (NASDAQ:RIVN), and suggest that \"watch and wait\" is the best move with Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA), LCID stock has the greatest downside risk. Largely, because the company is caught in a dilution spiral. The company has for years struggled to increase production, find demand for its existing production capacity, and move toward becoming profitable. Based on the electric vehicle maker’s latest quarterly results, things are getting worse, not better. With this, Lucid will likely keep raising capital through the sale of new shares to its majority owner, Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund. Barring material improvements to Lucid’s operating performance, this has, and will continue to, place heavy pressure on LCID shares. Riot Platforms (RIOT) Source: rafapress \/ Shutterstock.comBitcoin (BTC-USD) has been booming since the start of the year. Presumably, that would be good news for Bitcoin mining companies like Riot Platforms (NASDAQ:RIOT), but there’s a good reason RIOT has zigzagged rather than surged in price during this time frame. While first sparked by the launch of Bitcoin ETFs, the continued wave has been sustained by the upcoming Bitcoin halving event. While the halving may or may not provide a continued boost for BTC prices, the halving, which will reduce mining rewards by 50%, is a major challenge for crypto mining companies. Despite Riot’s ambitious expansion plans (which may outweigh the impact of halving), there is high uncertainty over future results. Sell side forecasts for 2025 earnings range widely. If you want to profit from mainstream adoption of crypto, consider buying BTC itself. Additionally, think about selling RIOT stock, which is one of the Nasdaq stocks to sell here. Roku (ROKU) Source: ShutterstockOver the past month, investors have bailed on Roku (NASDAQ:ROKU) shares. While some of this has had to do with the mixed reaction among analysts and investors about the streaming TV company’s latest fiscal results, some recent merger news has been the main culprit. Following Walmart’s (NYSE:WMT) announced acquisition of smart TV maker Vizio (NYSE:VZIO), concerns run high about the impact of this deal on ROKU stock. The retailing giant may achieve significant cost and growth synergies from this deal at Roku’s expense, as Guggenheim Securities’ Michael Morris has argued. Roku is already operating in the red. The company is anticipated to stay unprofitable until at least next year. As the Walmart\/Vizio tie-up could further delay (or even prevent) Roku’s efforts to become consistently profitable, it may be time to pull the plug on ROKU shares. Symbotic (SYM) Source: T. Schneider \/ Shutterstock.comAmong AI stocks, Symbotic (NASDAQ:SYM) is one of the top Nasdaq stocks to sell. Since the AI boom kicked off early last year, shares in this warehouse automation technology company have soared alongside the trend, rising from the low teens to (at one point) prices over $60 per share. However, SYM stock has started to pull back. As Thomas Yeung and InvestorPlace earnings reported on Feb. 5, the market reacted negatively to Symbotic’s mixed guidance issued in its latest quarterly earnings release. Slowing growth could continue to be troublesome for shares. With a triple-digit forward multiple, shares could correct 50% or even more, and still be considered richly priced. That’s not to say that this will happen, but as this factor harms SYM’s risk\/return proposition, consider it best to sell\/stay away. Wendy’s (WEN) Source: Deutschlandreform \/ Shutterstock.comWendy’s (NASDAQ:WEN) has made headlines recently, and not in a good way. Last month reports surfaced that the fast-food chain had plans to use surge pricing at its locations starting next year. However, following backlash, the company quickly clarified its plans to use digital menu boards, stressing that it does not intend to implement surge pricing. This may be good news for fans of the Baconator and the Frosty. However, for WEN stock investors, this news may be little more than cold comfort. Why? Despite the company addressing surge pricing fears (which could have been detrimental to store traffic), a myriad of other issues could keep shares under pressure, making this another Nasdaq stock to sell. As a Seeking Alpha commentator recently argued, these include declining same-store sales, too much leverage on its balance sheet, and a rich valuation despite these challenges. On the date of publication, Thomas Niel held Bitcoin. He did not hold (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. intelligence, crypto mining, and electric vehicles may be what first comes to mind. </p><p>However, while there are stocks in these industries well worth pressing the “sell” button on, it’s important to note the Nasdaq Exchange, while associated strongly with <a class="auto-linked-term" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-types/growth-stocks/">growth stocks</a> and <a class="auto-linked-term" href="https://investorplace.com/industries/technology/">tech stocks</a>, has listings for a wide variety of stocks.</p><p>According to <em>Finviz</em>, <a href="https://finviz.com/screener.ashx?v=111&f=exch_nasd" rel="nofollow">over 4000 stocks</a> are Nasdaq-listed. The Nasdaq is also the world’s <a href="https://www.statista.com/statistics/270126/largest-stock-exchange-operators-by-market-capitalization-of-listed-companies/" rel="nofollow">second-largest stock exchange by market cap</a>, second only to the New York Stock Exchange. </p><p>As such, the list of Nasdaq stocks runs the gamut, from mega-cap to micro-cap, from new school to old school, and from speculative growth to deep value.</p><p>As we’ll see below, alongside some questionable AI, crypto, and electric vehicle plays trading on the Nasdaq exchange, there are quite a few Nasdaq stocks to sell that fit into this other, wider category.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">eXp World Holdings (EXPI)</h2><div id="2181543" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/expi_1600-300x169.png" decoding="async" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/expi_1600-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/expi_1600-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/expi_1600-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/expi_1600-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/expi_1600-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/expi_1600-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/expi_1600-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/expi_1600-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/expi_1600-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/expi_1600-78x44.png 78w, Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>eXp World Holdings</strong> (NASDAQ:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/expi-stock-quote/"><strong>EXPI</strong></a>) is a real estate services company. The company is both a real estate brokerage firm and a provider of technology/lead generation services to real estate agents.</p><p>EXPI stock took a dive when the pandemic-era housing boom cooled down in 2022, but shares have held up reasonably well in the past year. Expectations run high that lower interest rates will spur a housing market comeback, either this year or next year.</p><p>Earnings forecasts for eXp World Holdings call for earnings to soar from <a href="https://www.wsj.com/market-data/quotes/EXPI" rel="nofollow">24 to 44 cents per share</a> between 2024 and 2025, presumably because of a rate-cut rebound. </p><p>However, with the Federal Reserve still <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-03-07/powell-says-fed-not-far-from-confidence-needed-to-cut-rates" rel="nofollow">“monitoring the situation” with interest rates</a>, you may not want to wager that this earnings recovery for EXPI will take shape so quickly, especially as shares trade at a pricey 30.6 times this 2025 forecast.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Robinhood Markets (HOOD)</h2><div id="1949717" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/robinhood-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="Robinhood app logo seen on smartphone on US class="ipm_image_source">Source: mundissima / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>Some of the Nasdaq stocks to sell are stocks favorited by retail traders using platforms like <strong>Robinhood Markets’</strong> (NASDAQ:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/hood-stock-quote/"><strong>HOOD</strong></a>) brokerage firm, but HOOD itself is also on this list. </p><p>Since late November, shares in the company have more than doubled in price.</p><p>This rebound in retail market speculation, especially in areas like crypto, can be attributed to the increase in demand boosting Robinhood’s fiscal results. For instance, for Q4 2023, the company positively surprised investors, by <a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/robinhood-markets-earnings-stock-price-78b1241a?mod=md_stockoverview_news" rel="nofollow">reporting positive earnings for the period</a>.</p><p>Yet while an end to “crypto winter” (ironically, taking shape near the start of astronomical winter in the northern hemisphere) has been a boon for Robinhood and for HOOD stock, this may prove fleeting. </p><p>Shares now trade at a rich 77.7 times forward earnings. Any sort of slowdown in crypto/stock trading activity could spark big disappointment, and a big reversal for this stock.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Lucid Group (LCID)</h2><div id="1883489" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Around the World Photos / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>Shares in many electric vehicle manufacturers trade on the Nasdaq, but among the larger Nasdaq <a class="auto-linked-term" href="https://investorplace.com/industries/consumer-discretionary/automotive/electric-vehicles/">electric vehicle stocks</a>, <strong>Lucid Group</strong> (NASDAQ:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/lcid-stock-quote/"><strong>LCID</strong></a>) is the one most deserving of a sell rating.</p><p>Although I’m <a href="https://investorplace.com/2024/02/rivn-stock-analysis-sell-rivian-before-the-slide-continues/">bearish</a> on <strong>Rivian Automotive</strong> (NASDAQ:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/rivn-stock-quote/"><strong>RIVN</strong></a>), and suggest that <a href="https://investorplace.com/2024/02/tsla-stock-dont-expect-a-fast-charge-with-tesla-anytime-soon/">“watch and wait”</a> is the best move with <strong>Tesla</strong> (NASDAQ:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/tsla-stock-quote/"><strong>TSLA</strong></a>), LCID stock has the greatest downside risk. </p><p>Largely, because the company is <a href="https://investorplace.com/2024/01/lcid-stock-sell-off-has-lucid-reached-the-end-of-the-road/">caught in a dilution spiral</a>. The company has for years struggled to increase production, find demand for its existing production capacity, and move toward becoming profitable.</p><p>Based on the electric vehicle maker’s <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/news/4069935-lucid-shares-fall-after-q4-sales-drop-39-loss-widens" rel="nofollow">latest quarterly results</a>, things are getting worse, not better. With this, Lucid will likely keep raising capital through the sale of new shares to its majority owner, Saudi Arabia’s <strong>Public Investment Fund</strong>. </p><p>Barring material improvements to Lucid’s operating performance, this has, and will continue to, place heavy pressure on LCID shares.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Riot Platforms (RIOT)</h2><div id="2394468" class="wp-caption Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>Bitcoin</strong> (<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/cryptocurrency/btc-usd/"><strong>BTC-USD</strong></a>) has been booming since the start of the year. </p><p>Presumably, that would be good news for Bitcoin mining companies like <strong>Riot Platforms</strong> (NASDAQ:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/riot-stock-quote/"><strong>RIOT</strong></a>), but there’s a good reason RIOT has zigzagged rather than surged in price during this time frame.</p><p>While first sparked by the launch of Bitcoin ETFs, the continued wave has been sustained by the upcoming Bitcoin halving event. </p><p>While the halving <a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/bitcoin-halving-etfs-blackrock-fidelity-28609049" rel="nofollow">may or may not provide a continued boost for BTC prices</a>, the halving, which will reduce mining rewards by 50%, is a major challenge for crypto mining companies.</p><p>Despite Riot’s ambitious <a href="https://www.riotplatforms.com/riot-announces-february-2024-production-and-operations-updates/" rel="nofollow">expansion plans</a> (which may outweigh the impact of halving), there is high uncertainty over future results. Sell side forecasts for 2025 earnings <a href="https://www.wsj.com/market-data/quotes/RIOT" rel="nofollow">range widely</a>. If you want to profit from mainstream adoption of crypto, consider buying BTC itself. Additionally, think about selling RIOT stock, which is one of the Nasdaq stocks to sell here.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Roku (ROKU)</h2><div id="1411496" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/roku1600c-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/roku-stock-quote/"><strong>ROKU</strong></a>) shares. </p><p>While some of this has had to do with the <a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/roku-stock-earnings-downgrade-845fb77f?mod=md_stockoverview_news" rel="nofollow">mixed reaction</a> among analysts and investors about the streaming TV company’s latest fiscal results, some recent merger news has been the main culprit.</p><p>Following <strong>Walmart’s</strong> (NYSE:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/wmt-stock-quote/"><strong>WMT</strong></a>) <a href="https://corporate.walmart.com/news/2024/02/20/walmart-agrees-to-acquire-vizio-holding-corp-to-facilitate-accelerated-growth-of-walmart-connect-through-vizio-s-smartcast-operating-system" rel="nofollow">announced acquisition</a> of smart TV maker <strong>Vizio</strong> (NYSE:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/vzio-stock-quote/"><strong>VZIO</strong></a>), concerns run high about the impact of this deal on ROKU stock. </p><p>The retailing giant may achieve significant cost and growth synergies from this deal <a href="https://www.investors.com/news/technology/roku-stock-sinks-after-walmart-vizio-acquisition/" rel="nofollow">at Roku’s expense</a>, as Guggenheim Securities’ Michael Morris has argued.</p><p>Roku is already operating in the red. The company is anticipated to stay unprofitable until <a href="https://www.wsj.com/market-data/quotes/ROKU" rel="nofollow">at least next year</a>. As the Walmart/Vizio tie-up could further delay (or even prevent) Roku’s efforts to become consistently profitable, it may be time to pull the plug on ROKU shares.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Symbotic (SYM)</h2><div id="2701850" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/sym1600-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="Person holding smartphone with website of US robotics warehouse company Symbotic Inc. on screen with logo. Focus on center of phone display. Unmodified photo. SYM stock" class="alignright wp-image-2701850" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/sym1600-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/sym1600-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/sym1600-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/sym1600-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/sym1600-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/sym1600-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/sym1600-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/sym1600-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/sym1600-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/sym1600-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/sym1600.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: T. Schneider / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>Among <a class="auto-linked-term" href="https://investorplace.com/industries/technology/artificial-intelligence/">AI stocks</a>, <strong>Symbotic</strong> (NASDAQ:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/sym-stock-quote/"><strong>SYM</strong></a>) is one of the top Nasdaq stocks to sell. </p><p>Since the AI boom kicked off early last year, shares in this warehouse automation technology company have soared alongside the trend, rising from the low teens to (at one point) prices over $60 per share.</p><p>However, SYM stock has started to pull back. As Thomas Yeung and <em>InvestorPlace</em> earnings reported on Feb. 5, the market reacted negatively to <a href="https://investorplace.com/2024/02/sym-stock-why-this-ai-play-is-cratering-20-today-symbotic/">Symbotic’s mixed guidance</a> issued in its latest quarterly earnings release. </p><p>Slowing growth could continue to be troublesome for shares. With a triple-digit forward multiple, shares could correct 50% or even more, and still be considered richly priced. </p><p>That’s not to say that this will happen, but as this factor harms SYM’s risk/return proposition, consider it best to sell/stay away.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Wendy’s (WEN)</h2><div id="2105362" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/wendys-1600-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="A photo of a Wendy's chicken sandwich and chicken nuggets." class="alignright wp-image-2105362" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/wendys-1600-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/wendys-1600-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/wendys-1600-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/wendys-1600-1536x864.jpg 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/wendys-1600-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/wendys-1600-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/wendys-1600-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/wendys-1600-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/wendys-1600-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/wendys-1600-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/wendys-1600.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Deutschlandreform / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>Wendy’s</strong> (NASDAQ:<a class="ipm-ticker-link" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/wen-stock-quote/"><strong>WEN</strong></a>) has made headlines recently, and not in a good way. Last month reports surfaced that the fast-food chain had plans to use surge pricing at its locations starting next year.</p><p>However, following backlash, the company quickly clarified its plans to use digital menu boards, stressing that it <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2024/02/28/business/wendys-dynamic-pricing-surge-explained/index.html" rel="nofollow">does not intend to implement surge pricing</a>. </p><p>This may be good news for fans of the Baconator and the Frosty. However, for WEN stock investors, this news may be little more than cold comfort.</p><p>Why? Despite the company addressing surge pricing fears (which could have been detrimental to store traffic), a myriad of other issues could keep shares under pressure, making this another Nasdaq stock to sell. </p><p>As a <em>Seeking Alpha</em> commentator recently argued, these include <a href="https://seekingalpha.com/article/4667069-wendys-overleveraged-balance-sheet-and-rich-valuation-make-it-a-sell" rel="nofollow">declining same-store sales</a>, too much leverage on its balance sheet, and a rich valuation despite these challenges.</p><p><em>On the date of publication, Thomas Niel held Bitcoin. He did not hold (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com </em><a href="https://investorplace.com/corporate/investorplace-publishing-guidelines/"><em>Publishing articles.title: Bitcoin Breakout Buddies: Top 3 Stocks to Sync With the Soaring OG Crypto
summarizedBulletPoints: - Bitcoin (BTC) has reached new highs recently, with analysts predicting it could reach $88,000 this year and possibly $100,000 by next year. This has piqued interest in crypto-related stocks, especially with the growth in Bitcoin ETFs.

- **Riot Platforms (RIOT)** is highlighted as a leading crypto-related stock, known for having the lowest production cost in the industry, thus yielding the highest margins for Bitcoin. It reported a record hashrate and a 19% BTC production quarter-over-quarter (QOQ). Analysts are optimistic, forecasting its price could double to an average target of $20.00 per share. RIOT's partnership with Reformed Energy to generate energy from landfill waste could be a significant growth driver.

- Marathon Digital (MARA) is discussed as the “largest” Bitcoin miner that retains mined BTC instead of selling it. Its Bitcoin production was 22% higher last month compared to 2023, and its Bitcoin holdings have increased by 49% year-on-year (YOY). The company trades at a modest P/E ratio and recently posted a 229% Q4 revenue increase, with a significant rise in its hashrate and a reduction in debt by 56%.

- Microstrategy (MSTR) is the largest institutional holder of Bitcoin globally, with over 205,000 Bitcoins. It recently planned to purchase an additional 12,000 Bitcoins for $821.7 million. MSTR closely ties its business performance to the trajectory of Bitcoin and its stock soared 14% following the announcement of its additional Bitcoin acquisition.
articles.desc: Crypto-related stocks Riot Platforms, Marathon Digital and MicroStrategy are leading the charge alongside Bitcoin's meteoric rise.

"headline": "Bitcoin Breakout Buddies: Top 3 Stocks to Sync With the Soaring OG Crypto",    "datePublished": "2024-03-14T10:35:49-04:00",    "dateModified": "2024-03-14T10:35:57-04:00",    "image": {        "@type": "ImageObject",        "url": "https:\/\/investorplace.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2023\/04\/crypto-mining-stocks1600.png",        "height": 900,        "width": 1600    },    "articleBody": "Analysts predict Bitcoin (BTC-USD) could reach $100,000, fueling a potential rise in crypto-related stocks, with ETFs driving the current price surge. Riot Platforms (RIOT): Operating with the industry's lowest production cost, Riot boasts high margins and a bullish outlook, with predictions of its stock price potentially doubling. Marathon Digital (MARA): As the \"largest\" Bitcoin miner trading at an attractive P\/E, its output increased by 22% last month, and its BTC holdings are 49% up YOY. MicroStrategy (MSTR): The largest institutional holder recently saw its stock jump 14% after plans to acquire an additional 12,000 Bitcoins, highlighting its aggressive investment strategy. The time to look into crypto-related stocks has arrived as Bitcoin (BTC-USD) has reached new highs recently, again. According to analysts who remain optimistic about its prospects, BTC could reach $88,000 this year, with more bullish analysts forecasting $100,000 by next year. However, while the premier cryptocurrency has been trending higher lately, these moves have been somewhat volatile, and perhaps this can transpire into crypto-related stocks. Many analysts cite the growth in Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) as the primary driver of the recent price action. Inflows into ETFs have set new records, and there are no signs of slowing. Further interest rate cuts by the Fed could also boost risk appetite and support higher bitcoin prices. In turn, some crypto-related stocks may be due to a rise. With Bitcoin dubbed “digital gold,” higher BTC prices could lift crypto-related stocks of Bitcoin miners. As Bitcoin hits new highs, average daily mining revenues increase. Unlike gold, some crypto-related companies hold Bitcoin reserves directly. Therefore, several crypto-related stocks across sectors may see an upside in the coming months, courtesy of Bitcoin’s rise. €‹ Riot Platforms (RIOT) Source: rafapress \/ Shutterstock.comRiot Platforms (NASDAQ:RIOT) is the first of the crypto-related stocks to cover. The Bitcoin miner is understood to have the lowest production cost in the industry. As such, it has the highest margins for Bitcoin. Any increase in the price of BTC boosts the company’s bottom line. The crypto-related company recently reported a record hashrate and a 19% BTC production quarter-over-quarter (QOQ). Analysts appear optimistic about the crypto-related stock, forecasting its price will double at an average target price of $20.00 per share. Notably, RIOT’s EPS is currently sitting at 0.28. However, most analysts estimate EPS to turn positive to 0.38 in 2025. The recent partnership with Reformed Energy to generate energy from landfill waste and power their mining operations may be one of the catalysts for the milestone. Marathon Digital (MARA) Source: T. Schneider \/ Shutterstock.comThe crypto-related company Marathon Digital (NASDAQ:MARA) is considered the “largest” Bitcoin miner in part because it retains mined BTC. Other miners, such as Riot, sell their BTC to generate profits. The company saw its Bitcoin production 22% higher just last month compared to 2023, despite experiencing unplanned outages due to power failures at its Florida facilities. Marathon’s Bitcoin holdings have also risen to 16,900, representing a 49% increase year-on-year (YOY). The crypto-related stock trades at a relatively modest price-to-earnings (P\/E) ratio of 19.5x, slightly below Nasdaq’s 21.2x for a Bitcoin technology stock. €‹ It recently posted a 229% Q4 revenue increase, net income of 229%, and $261 million while seeing its hashrate soar 253% and debt downsized by 56%. Higher bitcoin prices and transaction fees will likely boost Marathon’s sales and profitability as the company shifts away from a third-party hosted mining company to improve its operational efficiency as a self-mining firm. Microstrategy (MSTR) Source: Billion Photos \/ Shutterstock.comMicrostrategy (NASDAQ:MSTR) is the last of the crypto-related stocks to pick. It is the largest institutional holder of Bitcoin globally, owning over 205,000 Bitcoins. This exceeds holdings of Bitcoin ETFs, including those managed by Blackrock (NYSE:BLK) through its iShares Bitcoin Trust (NASDAQ:IBIT). Its founder, Michael Sailor, is a Bitcoin proponent and believes the total market capitalization of the leading cryptocurrency could surpass gold. This implies a further ten-fold increase may be realized. MSTR has pursued a strategy of exploiting increased share prices to sell stock and finance new Bitcoin acquisitions, further connecting the business’s performance to the path of the cryptocurrency. €‹ The crypto-related stock soared 14% recently following an announcement to purchase an additional 12,000 Bitcoins for $821.7 million. On the date of publication, Stavros Tousios did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/riot-stock-quote/"><strong>RIOT</strong></a></span>): Operating with the industry’s lowest production cost, Riot boasts high margins and a bullish outlook, with predictions of its stock price potentially doubling.</li><li><strong>Marathon Digital </strong>(<span style="text-decoration: underline"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/mara-stock-quote/"><strong>MARA</strong></a></span>): As the “largest” Bitcoin miner trading at an attractive P/E, its output increased by 22% last month, and its BTC holdings are 49% up YOY.</li><li><strong>MicroStrategy </strong>(<span style="text-decoration: underline"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/mstr-stock-quote/"><strong>MSTR</strong></a></span>): The largest institutional holder recently saw its stock jump 14% after plans to acquire an additional 12,000 Bitcoins, highlighting its aggressive investment strategy.</li></ul>							</div>							<div class="ad-wrapper"></div>														<figure class="entry-featured-image">			<div>				<img Gaston Cerliani / Shutterstock.com</p>									</figcaption>					</figure>							<div class="entry-content story">							<p>The time to look into crypto-related stocks has arrived as <strong>Bitcoin </strong>(<a target="_blank" href="https://investorplace.com/cryptocurrency/btc-usd/" rel="noreferrer noopener"><strong>BTC-USD</strong></a>) has reached new highs recently, again. According to analysts who remain optimistic about its prospects, BTC could reach $88,000 this year, with more bullish analysts forecasting <a target="_blank" href="https://www.forbes.com/advisor/investing/cryptocurrency/can-bitcoin-reach-100k/" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">$100,000 by next year</a>. However, while the premier cryptocurrency has been trending higher lately, these moves have been somewhat volatile, and perhaps this can transpire into crypto-related stocks.</p><p>Many analysts cite the growth in Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) as the primary driver of the recent price action. <a target="_blank" href="https://finance.yahoo.com/video/bitcoin-soars-above-record-72k-154228609.html" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">Inflows into ETFs have set new records</a>, and there are no signs of slowing. Further interest rate cuts by the Fed could also boost risk appetite and support higher bitcoin prices. In turn, some crypto-related stocks may be due to a rise.</p><p>With Bitcoin dubbed “digital gold,” higher BTC prices could lift crypto-related stocks of Bitcoin miners. As Bitcoin hits new highs, average daily mining revenues increase. Unlike gold, some crypto-related companies <a target="_blank" href="https://decrypt.co/47061/public-companies-biggest-bitcoin-portfolios" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">hold Bitcoin reserves</a> directly. Therefore, several crypto-related stocks across sectors may see an upside in the coming months, courtesy of Bitcoin’s rise.​</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading"><strong>Riot Platforms (RIOT)</strong></h2><div id="2394468" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="In this photo illustration, the Riot Platforms (RIOT) logo is displayed on a smartphone screen." class="alignright wp-image-2394468" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/riot1600.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source:  rafapress / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>Riot Platforms </strong>(NASDAQ:<a target="_blank" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/riot-stock-quote/" rel="noreferrer noopener"><strong>RIOT</strong></a>) is the first of the crypto-related stocks to cover. The Bitcoin miner is understood to have the <a target="_blank" href="https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/this-1-magic-number-will-tell-you-if-a-bitcoin-mining-stock-is-worth-buying" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">lowest production cost</a> in the industry. As such, it has the highest margins for Bitcoin. Any increase in the price of BTC boosts the company’s bottom line. The crypto-related company recently reported a record hashrate and a <a target="_blank" href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/riot-platforms-reports-full-2023-214500631.html" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">19% BTC production</a> quarter-over-quarter (QOQ).</p><p>Analysts appear optimistic about the crypto-related stock, forecasting <a target="_blank" href="https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/RIOT?.tsrc=fin-srch" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">its price will double</a> at an average target price of $20.00 per share. Notably, RIOT’s EPS is currently sitting at 0.28. However, most analysts estimate EPS to turn positive to 0.38 in 2025. The recent partnership with Reformed Energy to generate <a target="_blank" href="https://www.altcoinbuzz.io/cryptocurrency-news/riot-platforms-powers-bitcoin-with-waste-energy/" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">energy from landfill waste</a> and power their mining operations may be one of the catalysts for the milestone.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading"><strong>Marathon Digital (MARA)</strong></h2><div id="2671936" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mara1600-1-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="Person holding mobile phone with logo of American company Marathon Digital Holdings Inc. on screen in front of web page. Focus on phone display. Unmodified photo. MARA stock" class="alignright wp-image-2671936" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mara1600-1-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mara1600-1-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mara1600-1-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mara1600-1-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mara1600-1-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mara1600-1-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mara1600-1-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mara1600-1-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mara1600-1-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mara1600-1-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/mara1600-1.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: T. Schneider / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p>The crypto-related company <strong>Marathon Digital </strong>(NASDAQ:<a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/mara-stock-quote/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener"><strong><u>MARA</u></strong></a>) is considered the “largest” Bitcoin miner in part because it retains mined BTC. Other miners, such as Riot, sell their BTC to generate profits. The company saw its Bitcoin <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/marathon-digital-holdings-announces-bitcoin-222300538.html" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">production 22% higher</a> just last month compared to 2023, despite experiencing unplanned outages due to power failures at its Florida facilities. Marathon’s Bitcoin holdings have also risen to 16,900, representing a 49% increase year-on-year (YOY).</p><p>The crypto-related stock trades at a relatively modest price-to-earnings <a target="_blank" href="https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/MARA?.tsrc=fin-srch" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">(P/E) ratio of 19.5x</a>, slightly below Nasdaq’s 21.2x for a Bitcoin technology stock.​ It recently posted a <a target="_blank" href="https://ir.mara.com/news-events/press-releases/detail/1345/marathon-digital-holdings-reports-fourth-quarter-and-fiscal" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">229% Q4 revenue</a> increase, net income of 229%, and $261 million while seeing its hashrate soar 253% and debt downsized by 56%. Higher bitcoin prices and transaction fees will likely boost Marathon’s sales and profitability as the company shifts away from a third-party hosted mining company to improve its operational efficiency as a self-mining firm.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading"><strong>Microstrategy (MSTR)</strong></h2><div id="2740190" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/mstr1600-1-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="Bitcoin BTC representation coin with MicroStrategy (MSTR) text in background." class="alignright wp-image-2740190" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/mstr1600-1-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/mstr1600-1-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/mstr1600-1-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/mstr1600-1-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/mstr1600-1-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/mstr1600-1-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/mstr1600-1-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/mstr1600-1-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/mstr1600-1-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/mstr1600-1-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/mstr1600-1.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Billion Photos / Shutterstock.com</div></div><p><strong>Microstrategy</strong> (NASDAQ:<a target="_blank" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/mstr-stock-quote/" rel="noreferrer noopener"><strong>MSTR</strong></a>) is the last of the crypto-related stocks to pick. It is the <a target="_blank" href="https://www.theblock.co/post/281654/microstrategy-bitcoin-205000-btc-blackrock" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">largest institutional holder</a> of Bitcoin globally, owning over 205,000 Bitcoins. This exceeds holdings of Bitcoin ETFs, including those managed by <strong>Blackrock</strong> (NYSE:<a target="_blank" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/blk-stock-quote/" rel="noreferrer noopener"><strong>BLK</strong></a>) through its <strong>iShares Bitcoin Trust </strong>(NASDAQ:<a target="_blank" href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/ibit-stock-quote/" rel="noreferrer noopener"><strong>IBIT</strong></a>). Its founder, Michael Sailor, is a Bitcoin proponent and believes the total market capitalization of the leading cryptocurrency could surpass gold. This implies a further ten-fold increase may be realized.</p><p>MSTR has pursued a strategy of exploiting increased share prices to sell stock and finance new Bitcoin acquisitions, further connecting the business’s performance to the path of the cryptocurrency.​ The crypto-related <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/microstrategy-shares-spikes-company-buys-062015859.html" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener nofollow">stock soared 14%</a> recently following an announcement to purchase an additional 12,000 Bitcoins for $821.7 million.</p><p><em>On the date of publication, Stavros Tousios did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com </em><a href="https://investorplace.com/corporate/investorplace-publishing-guidelines/"><em>Publishing Guidelines</em></a>.</p><div class="ipm-author-short-bio"><p>Stavros Tousios, MBA, is the founder and chief analyst at Markets Untold. articles.title: 3 Compelling Crypto Stocks to Buy Before They Go Ballistic
summarizedBulletPoints: - Riot Platforms (RIOT) is highlighted for significant growth potential in the cryptocurrency sector, with a notable 22% increase in stock price over the last six months.
- Riot has a robust financial foundation with $908 million in cash and equivalents, including Bitcoin holdings, and operates with zero debt, presenting high financial flexibility for investments.

- The company has ambitious expansion plans through 2025, aiming to increase its hash rate capacity from 12.4EH/s at the end of the previous year to 31.5EH/s and 40.8EH/s by the end of 2024 and 2025, respectively.
- Riot Platforms is positioned for potentially substantial returns, with projected 2x to 3x returns within the next two quarters as the cryptocurrency market, especially Bitcoin, continues to rally.

- The company's aggressive capacity expansion strategy is likely to translate into considerable revenue and cash flow growth, contributing to its bullish outlook in the cryptocurrency mining industry.
articles.desc: These are the attractively valued crypto stocks to buy and represents Bitcoin miners with big hash rate capacity expansion plans.

"2024-03-13T06:31:53-04:00",    "image": {        "@type": "ImageObject",        "url": "https:\/\/investorplace.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/04\/blockchain-2.jpg",        "height": 900,        "width": 1600    },    "articleBody": "These are the crypto stocks to buy before they skyrocket on the back of stellar revenue and cash flow growth. Riot Platforms (RIOT): A strong balance sheet and significant hash rate capacity expansion plans through 2025. Bitfarms (BITF): An undervalued penny stock with a clean balance sheet and high financial flexibility to pursue aggressive expansion. Marathon Digital (MARA): Targeting to increase energized hash rate capacity to 50EH\/s in the next 18 to 24 months. At the blink of an eye, Bitcoin (BTC-USD) has surged and is trading at new all-time highs. With the halving even due, I expect the positive momentum to sustain. Analysts are talking about the cryptocurrency touching $115,000 after halving. In the coming quarters, investors can expect some big action in the altcoin space. Another way of exposure to the crypto bull market is through crypto stocks. Given the point that Bitcoin is likely to surge above $100,000 this year, I am bullish on some of the best Bitcoin miners. If the Bitcoin rally sustains, mining stocks are poised for multibagger returns from current levels with an investment horizon of 24 months. I must add that the impact of halving is discounted in Bitcoin mining stocks. The focus in the next few quarters is likely to be on the EBITDA margin and cash flows. I am optimistic on that front and as the cash buffer for miners swell, they will be positioned for further expansion or diversification. Let's therefore discuss three crypto stocks to buy for multibagger returns in the next 24 months Riot Platforms (RIOT) Source: Marko Aliaksandr\/ShutterStock.comRiot Platforms (NASDAQ:RIOT) stock has trended higher by 22% in the last six months. However, with Bitcoin trading at new all-time highs, the best part of the rally is due for RIOT stock. The Bitcoin miner has strong fundamentals and an aggressive expansion plan that backs the bull thesis. From a financial perspective, Riot reported cash and equivalents (including Bitcoin holdings) of $908 million as of Q4 2023. Further, with a zero-debt balance sheet, financial flexibility is high for big investments. It's not surprising that Riot has big expansion plans through 2025. At the end of last year, the Company reported hash rate capacity of 12.4EH\/s. Capacity is likely to increase to 31.5EH\/s and 40.8EH\/s towards the end of 2024 and 2025 respectively. Given the rally in Bitcoin, this is likely to translate into stellar revenue and cash flow upside. In my view, RIOT stock is poised for 2x or 3x returns within the next two quarters. Bitfarms (BITF) Source: Venomous Vector\/ShutterstockAmong penny crypto stocks, Bitfarms (NASDAQ:BITF) looks attractive for multibagger gains. Currently, BITF stock trades at $2.4. I would not be surprised if the stock is trading in double digits by the end of the year. An important point to note is that Bitfarms reported a liquidity buffer of $118 million as of December 2023. Recently, the Company announced a $375 million at-the-market equity offering. Therefore, Bitfarms has high financial flexibility to pursue aggressive expansion. Further, the Company has a debt-free balance sheet. From the perspective of expansion, Bitfarms reported hash rate capacity of 6.5EH\/s as of February. The Company is targeting to increase capacity to 21EH\/s in the second half of the year. With tripling of mining capacity, I expect stellar revenue and cash flow growth. Further, if sentiments remain positive, I expect Bitfarms to announce the next round of expansion that targeted for 2025. Marathon Digital (MARA) Source: ShutterstockAt a forward price-earnings ratio of 22.2, Marathon Digital (NASDAQ:MARA) is another attractive Bitcoin miner to consider. MARA stock has surged by 200% in the last 12 months. However, considering the hash rate capacity expansion, I am bullish on further upside. It's worth noting that the Company's energized hash rate for 2023 has increased by 253% on a year-on-year basis to 24.7EH\/s. This translated into a 229% growth in revenue to $387.5 million. While growth has already been stellar, there are two important points to note. First, Marathon is positioned to benefit from higher realized Bitcoin price this year. I expect significant EBITDA margin expansion. Further, Marathon is targeting hash rate capacity of 50EH\/s in the next 18 to 24 months. Therefore, stellar revenue growth will sustain in the next few years. I must add that Marathon ended 2023 with cash and equivalents of $997 million. At the same time, the Company deleveraged significantly. Financial flexibility therefore remains high to invest in aggressive expansion plans. On the date of publication, Faisal Humayun did not hold (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com Publishing Guidelines. Faisal Humayun is a senior research analyst with 12 years of industry experience in the field of credit research, equity research and financial modeling. <strong>Bitcoin </strong>(<span class="crypto-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/cryptocurrency/btc-usd/"><strong><u>BTC-USD</u></strong></a></span>) has surged and is trading at new all-time highs. With the halving even due, I expect the positive momentum to sustain. Analysts are talking about the cryptocurrency touching $115,000 after halving. In the coming quarters, investors can expect some big action in the altcoin space. Another way of exposure to the crypto bull market is through crypto stocks.</p><p>Given the point that Bitcoin is likely to surge above $100,000 this year, I am bullish on some of the best Bitcoin miners. If the Bitcoin rally sustains, mining stocks are poised for multibagger returns from current levels with an investment horizon of 24 months.</p><p>I must add that the impact of halving is discounted in Bitcoin mining stocks. The focus in the next few quarters is likely to be on the EBITDA margin and cash flows. I am optimistic on that front and as the cash buffer for miners swell, they will be positioned for further expansion or diversification.</p><p>Let’s therefore discuss three crypto stocks to buy for multibagger returns in the next 24 months</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Riot Platforms (RIOT)</h2><div id="1664462" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/blockchain_tokenization_1600_b-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="An image of a hand holding a cell phone with several visualizations of digital building blocks floating above it. representing sto platforms" class="alignright wp-image-1664462" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/blockchain_tokenization_1600_b-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/blockchain_tokenization_1600_b-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/blockchain_tokenization_1600_b-768x432.jpg https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/blockchain_tokenization_1600_b-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/blockchain_tokenization_1600_b-400x225.jpg https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/blockchain_tokenization_1600_b-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/blockchain_tokenization_1600_b-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/blockchain_tokenization_1600_b-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/blockchain_tokenization_1600_b.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Marko Aliaksandr/ShutterStock.com</div></div><p><strong>Riot Platforms</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/riot-stock-quote/"><strong><u>RIOT</u></strong></a></span>) stock has trended higher by 22% in the last six months. However, with Bitcoin trading at new all-time highs, the best part of the rally is due for RIOT stock. The Bitcoin miner has strong fundamentals and an aggressive expansion plan that backs the bull thesis.</p><p>From a financial perspective, Riot reported cash and equivalents (including Bitcoin holdings) of $908 million as of Q4 2023. Further, with a zero-debt balance sheet, financial flexibility is high for big investments.</p><p>It’s not surprising that Riot has big expansion plans through 2025. At the end of last year, the Company reported hash rate capacity of 12.4EH/s. <a href="https://d2ghdaxqb194v2.cloudfront.net/2865/193123.pdf" rel="nofollow">Capacity is likely to increase</a> to 31.5EH/s and 40.8EH/s towards the end of 2024 and 2025 respectively. Given the rally in Bitcoin, this is likely to translate into stellar revenue and cash flow upside. In my view, RIOT stock is poised for 2x or 3x returns within the next two quarters.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Bitfarms (BITF)</h2><div id="2181722" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/blockchain-300x169.png" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="An image of 4 cubes connected in a web; blockchain" class="alignright wp-image-2181722" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/blockchain-300x169.png 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/blockchain-1024x576.png 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/blockchain-768x432.png 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/blockchain-1536x864.png 1536w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/blockchain-200x113.png 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/blockchain-400x225.png 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/blockchain-116x65.png 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/blockchain-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/blockchain-89x50.png 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/blockchain-78x44.png 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/blockchain.png 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Venomous Vector/Shutterstock</div></div><p>Among penny crypto stocks, <strong>Bitfarms</strong> (NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/bitf-stock-quote/"><strong><u>BITF</u></strong></a></span>) looks attractive for multibagger gains. Currently, BITF stock trades at $2.4. I would not be surprised if the stock is trading in double digits by the end of the year.</p><p>An important point to note is that Bitfarms reported a liquidity buffer of $118 million as of December 2023. Recently, the Company announced a $375 million at-the-market equity offering. Therefore, Bitfarms has high financial flexibility to pursue aggressive expansion. Further, the Company has a debt-free balance sheet.</p><p>From the perspective of expansion, Bitfarms reported hash rate capacity of 6.5EH/s as of February. The Company is <a href="https://d1io3yog0oux5.cloudfront.net/_a87994f8319a565afc7f0e4621dcd4f3/bitfarms/db/862/8427/pdf/BITF.03.01.24Preso.Final.pdf" rel="nofollow">targeting to increase capacity to 21EH/s</a> in the second half of the year. With tripling of mining capacity, I expect stellar revenue and cash flow growth.</p><p>Further, if sentiments remain positive, I expect Bitfarms to announce the next round of expansion that targeted for 2025.</p><h2 class="wp-block-heading">Marathon Digital (MARA)</h2><div id="1498408" class="wp-caption alignright"><img src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/plugins/lazy-load/images/1x1.trans.gif" data-lazy-src="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/blockchain-300x169.jpg" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" alt="futuristic image of a hand with the words block chain floating above it. representing riot blockchain stocks" class="alignright wp-image-1498408" srcset="https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/blockchain-300x169.jpg 300w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/blockchain-768x432.jpg 768w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/blockchain-1024x576.jpg 1024w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/blockchain-200x113.jpg 200w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/blockchain-400x225.jpg 400w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/blockchain-116x65.jpg 116w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/blockchain-100x56.jpg 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/blockchain-89x50.jpg 89w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/blockchain-78x44.jpg 78w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/blockchain.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"><div class="ipm_image_source">Source: Shutterstock</div></div><p>At a forward price-earnings ratio of 22.2, <strong>Marathon Digital </strong>(NASDAQ:<span class="stock-ticker"><a href="https://investorplace.com/stock-quotes/mara-stock-quote/"><strong><u>MARA</u></strong></a></span>) is another attractive Bitcoin miner to consider. MARA stock has surged by 200% in the last 12 months. However, considering the hash rate capacity expansion, I am bullish on further upside.</p><p>It’s worth noting that the Company’s <a href="https://ir.mara.com/news-events/press-releases/detail/1345/marathon-digital-holdings-reports-fourth-quarter-and-fiscal" rel="nofollow">energized hash rate for 2023</a> has increased by 253% on a year-on-year basis to 24.7EH/s. This translated into a 229% growth in revenue to $387.5 million. While growth has already been stellar, there are two important points to note.</p><p>First, Marathon is positioned to benefit from higher realized Bitcoin price this year. I expect significant EBITDA margin expansion. Further, Marathon is <a href="https://d1io3yog0oux5.cloudfront.net/_ab51a2447d2e7c6d1a78f7e58888ae7a/marathondh/db/288/5431/pdf/MARA+Acquires+2+Sites+From+Generate+-+Final.pdf" rel="nofollow">targeting hash rate capacity of 50EH/s</a> in the next 18 to 24 months. Therefore, stellar revenue growth will sustain in the next few years.</p><p>I must add that Marathon ended 2023 with cash and equivalents of $997 million. At the same time, the Company deleveraged significantly. Financial flexibility therefore remains high to invest in aggressive expansion plans.</p><p><em>On the date of publication, Faisal Humayun did not hold (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com </em><a href="https://investorplace.com/corporate/investorplace-publishing-guidelines/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener"><em>Publishing Guidelines.</em></a></p><div class="ipm-author-short-bio"><p>Faisal Humayun is a senior research analyst with 12 years of industry experience in the field of credit research, equity research and financial modeling. Faisal has authored over 1,500 stock specific articles with focus on the technology, energy and commodities sector.</p></div><div class="ipm-stock-types"><p><a articles.title: Rate Cut Renegades: 7 Stocks to Snag Before the Fed's Next Move
summarizedBulletPoints: - **Riot Platforms (RIOT)** is considered a promising investment in anticipation of Federal Reserve rate cuts, which may also positively impact the cryptocurrency space by encouraging higher speculation across different asset classes.
- RIOT, as a Bitcoin miner, is highlighted for its robust fundamentals and aggressive expansion plans.
- Riot Platforms reported $597 million in cash and $311 million in Bitcoin value on its balance sheet as of Q4 2023, indicating a strong financial position with no debt outstanding.

- Riot Platforms aims to aggressively expand its operations, planning to increase its hash rate capacity from 12.4EH/s at the end of 2023 to 31.5EH/s by the end of 2024 and further to 40.8EH/s in the second half of 2025. This expansion is expected to significantly drive the company's revenue and cash flow growth.

- RIOT's substantial investment in expanding its hash rate capacity underlines its commitment to growth in the cryptocurrency mining sector, positioning the company for potential stellar revenue and cash flow increases.

The summary strictly pertains to the content related to Riot Platforms (RIOT) mentioned in the provided HTML document, focusing on its financial health, expansion plans, and the potential impact of Federal Reserve rate cuts.
articles.desc: In February, economist David Rosenberg opined that there’s an 85% chance that the U.S. economy will enter recession in 2024. Of course, there are opposing views with many economists talking about the possibility of a soft landing. However, it’s relatively clear that expansionary monetary policies might be needed to avoid a hard landing. Possibly, there…

"2024-03-13T21:04:25-04:00",    "image": {        "@type": "ImageObject",        "url": "https:\/\/investorplace.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/10\/stocks-to-buy-greedy1600.png",        "height": 900,        "width": 1600    },    "articleBody": "Newmont (NEM): The company has an investment-grade balance sheet and strong cash flow. Occidental Petroleum (OXY): Quality oil assets coupled with robust free cash flows for deleveraging and dividends make this a must-have. Target (TGT): The company is seeing its second consecutive quarter of comparable sales growth. Read more about the top stocks to buy and hold ahead of the Federal Reserve's next move. In February, economist David Rosenberg opined that there's an 85% chance that the U.S. economy will enter recession in 2024. Of course, there are opposing views with many economists talking about the possibility of a soft landing. However, it's relatively clear that expansionary monetary policies might be needed to avoid a hard landing. Possibly, there will be more than one rate cut in the second half of 2024. Investors can therefore consider buying stocks for a Fed rate cut before they go ballistic. If we talk about specific sectors, precious metals, energy, and commodity stocks tend to do well during times of expansionary policies. At the same time, rate cuts boost investment and consumption spending. I would therefore look at creating a diversified portfolio of stocks (industry perspective) that will benefit from possible rate cuts. Let's talk about seven stocks for a Fed rate cut likely to surge higher in the next few quarters. Newmont (NEM) Source: Piotr Swat\/ShutterstockIn anticipation of expansionary monetary policies, gold has already been trending higher. It's a matter of time before some of the best gold mining stocks go ballistic. Newmont (NYSE:NEM) looks undervalued at a forward price-earnings ratio of 18.6. The blue-chip stock also offers an attractive dividend yield of 2.84%. I would bet on 30% to 50% total returns for NEM stock in the next 12 months. Newmont recently announced that the Company will focus on its tier one portfolio of ten assets. Further, Newmont will be selling six non-core assets. This is likely to boost the Company's financial flexibility and help in cost reduction. I must add that with 128 million ounces in gold reserves and 155 million ounces in resources, the Company has stable production visibility beyond the decade. It's also worth noting that for 2023, Newmont reported operating cash flow of $2.8 billion. With the completion of acquisition of Newcrest Mining and higher realized gold price, I expect significant bump-up in cash flows. With an investment grade balance sheet, Newmont is well positioned to create value. Occidental Petroleum (OXY) Source: Pavel Kapysh \/ Shutterstock.comEven as oil faces macroeconomic headwinds, Occidental Petroleum‘s (NYSE:OXY) stock has remained sideways in the last 12 months. The undervalued blue-chip stock offers a dividend yield of 1.43% and is another one of the top stocks for a Fed rate cut. If the Fed pursues rate cuts in the second half of 2024, I expect GDP growth to recover next year. Therefore, rate cuts will trigger positive price action for oil. OXY stock is likely to surge higher from depressed levels. From a financial perspective, there are two important points to note. First, Occidental has an investment-grade balance sheet. There is ample flexibility for organic and acquisition-driven growth. Last year, the company acquired CrownRock for a consideration of $12 billion. The asset is likely to be immediately accretive to free cash flows. Further, Occidental reported free cash flow of $5.5 billion last year. Healthy FCF will ensure value creation through dividends and share repurchase. At the same time, Occidental is focused on debt reduction and robust FCF will ensure that the targets are met. Target (TGT) Source: Sundry Photography \/ Shutterstock.comConsumption spending is a key GDP growth driver for the United States. A key part of consumption spending is retail sales. In a scenario of rate cuts, I expect retail spending to accelerate. This will be positive for some of the best retail stocks. Target (NYSE:TGT) recently touched a 52-week high. However, the stock remains attractive at a forward price-earnings ratio of 18. Further, TGT stock is undervalued when compared to peers like Costco (NASDAQ:COST) and Walmart (NYSE:WMT). It's also worth noting that Target is on the verge of a turnaround. The company reported strong Q4 2023 numbers and if key metrics continue to improve, there is ample scope for upside in TGT stock. For Q4 2023, Target reported comparable sales improvement for the second consecutive quarter. Further, the Company reported operating income margin of 5.3%, which was 200 basis points higher on a year-on-year basis. With operating efficiency and margin expansion, operating cash flows also swelled to $8.6 billion for 2023. Vale (VALE) Source: rafapress \/ Shutterstock.comVale (NYSE:VALE) is possibly the most undervalued industrial commodity stock. After a correction of 20% in the last 12 months, VALE stock trades at a forward price-earnings ratio of 5. Further, the stock offers a dividend yield of 9%. I would not be surprised if VALE stock doubles from current levels if there are multiple rate cuts in the next 12 months. While the stock has been depressed, Vale has robust fundamentals. For Q4 2023, the Company reported adjusted EBITDA and free cash flow of $6.7 billion and $2.5 billion. Therefore, there is high flexibility for dividends and aggressive capital investments. Another point to note is that the iron ore business is the key cash flow driver. However, Vale is diversified into copper and nickel production. These metals are likely to support global energy transition and I am bullish as Vale boosts production. For now, the potential upside in iron ore prices on the back of rate cuts is likely to translate into EBITDA margin expansion and FCF upside. It’s another of the top stocks for a Fed rate cut. Tesla (TSLA) Source: Roschetzky Photography \/ Shutterstock.comTesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) corrected sharply by 33% in the last six months. There are two reasons for the correction. First, intense competition has impacted growth. Further, Tesla has faced challenges due to macroeconomic headwinds. I therefore believe that potential rate cuts can trigger positive price action in Tesla stock. Besides making loan relatively cheaper, it's likely that macroeconomic headwinds will wane on expansionary policies. Specific to Tesla, Cybertruck is due for mass deliveries and that's a catalyst for revenue growth. Further, there seems to be excitement on the potential launch of Roadster in 2025. I must add here that Tesla has ambitious plans to produce 20 million EVs annually by 2030. To achieve this target, investment in multiple new factors is likely. The potential investments will possibly be focused on emerging economies. Tesla has already committed to cut EV production cost to half. This will set stage for the next leg of growth in emerging economies. Riot Platforms (RIOT) Source: ShutterstockIn my view, potential rate cuts will also be positive for the cryptocurrency space. Expansionary monetary policies, in general, translate into higher speculation across asset classes. Therefore, the ongoing crypto bull market is likely to have another catalyst in the form of rate cuts. Among crypto stocks that look attractive, I am bullish on Riot Platforms (NASDAQ:RIOT). The Bitcoin (BTC-USD) miner has strong fundamentals and aggressive expansion plans. In my view, at least 100% returns are likely in the next 12 months. From a fundamental perspective, Riot reported $597 million in cash buffer as of Q4 2023. Further, the value of Bitcoin in the balance sheet was $311 million. With no debt outstanding, Riot has a quality balance sheet. It's therefore not surprising that the Company is looking at aggressive expansion in the next 24 months. Riot ended 2023 with a hash rate capacity of 12.4EH\/s. The Company is targeting to increase capacity to 31.5EH\/s by the end of the year. Further, hash rate capacity is likely to swell to 40.8EH\/s in the second half of 2025. Therefore, Riot is positioned for stellar revenue and cash flow upside. Hecla Mining (HL) Source: Phawat \/ Shutterstock.comFinally, let's talk about a penny stock that's likely to benefit from potential rate cuts. Hecla Mining (NYSE:HL) is the largest silver mining company in the United States. I believe that silver will catch-up with gold in terms of returns in the coming quarters. HL stock will surge higher from undervalued levels if this assumption holds true. Besides higher realized price, there is another reason to be bullish on Hecla Mining. For 2023, the Company reported silver production of 3.1 million ounces. With Lucky Friday restarting production and the ramp-up of production from Keno Hill, I am bullish on robust growth. For this year, Hecla has guided for production of 5.1 million ounces. It's worth noting that production growth will sustain in 2025. Therefore, Hecla is positioned for strong revenue growth and cash flow upside. If silver surges higher, there is a case for significant EBITDA margin expansion in the second half of 2024 and in 2025. The penny stock is therefore worth accumulating at current levels. On the date of publication, Faisal Humayun did not hold (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer, subject to the InvestorPlace.com Publishing Guidelines. Faisal Humayun is a senior research analyst with 12 years of industry experience in the field of credit research, equity research and financial modeling. https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/stocks-to-buy-greedy1600-100x56.png 100w, https://investorplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/stocks-to-buy-greedy1600-89x50.png 89w,
